name: Jeffery Raphael
content: Jeffery Raphael | King's College London Skip to main contentDr Jeffery Raphael Lecturer in Computer ScienceResearch interestsComputer scienceContact details+44 020 7848 8665jeffery.raphael@kcl.ac.ukBiographyDr Jeffery Raphael is a Lecturer in Computer Science in the Department of Informatics, Kingâ€™s College London. He received his PhD at the University of Liverpool where he studied auction-based cooperation mechanisms in MultiAgent systems. He developed the first King's International Foundation, Introduction to Computer Science and Engineering module. This module is part of a programme that prepares international students for their entry into the UK Higher Education system. His research interests include cooperation in MultiAgent systems and application of Generative AI for automated marking & feedback and assessment creation. More specifically, how Generative AI techniques can be used to create assessment tasks that better match student ability. Jeffery is also a Fellow of the UK Higher Education Academy. Research Interests Machine learning Multi-agent System Intelligent Transportation Systems Generative AI Educational Chatbots ResearchResearchReasoning and PlanningThe group focuses on the fundamental AI challenge of creating, representing and reasoning.
